column8: This marinade started out from Durkee foods and changed to Weber but the item stayed the same.  This is a fantastic steak marinade but becoming harder to find.  We do hope that it is not discontinued, that would be a big mistake and we would not purchase any other Weber products and tell our friends to do the same.
column11: ['Grocery & Gourmet Food', 'Sauces, Gravies & Marinades', 'Seasoning Mixes']
column12:
['Weber White Wine & Herb Marinade Mix.
New look!
Same great taste.', 'Salt, Maltodextrin, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder, Spices, Citric Acid, Food Starch-Modified, Red Bell Pepper, Xanthan Gum, Sherry Wine Solids, Parsley, Disodium Inosinate, Vinegar, Artificial Flavor and less than 2% Silicon Dioxide to prevent caking.', 'All you need.
1 pack Weber marinade mix + 1/4 cup water + 1/4 cup olive oil or corn oil + 2 lbs fish or chicken.
All you do:
1. Combine marinade mix, water and oil in a resealable plastic bag; mix well.
2. Add meat, turning to coat. Seal bag; marinate in refrigerator 15 minutes or longer, turning meat occasionally.
3. Remove meat and discard remaining marinade. Grill as desired.
Variations:
Substitute orange or pineapple juice for the water.
Try adding 2 tablespoons chopped green onion to the marinade.
Serving tip: sprinkle freshly grated parmesan cheese on top of meat just before serving!', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']
column13: Weber Grill Marinade White Wine & Herb, 1.12-Ounce (Pack of 12)

Same great taste.', 'Salt, Maltodextrin, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder, Spices, Citric Acid, Food Starch-Modified, Red Bell Pepper, Xanthan Gum, Sherry Wine Solids, Parsley, Disodium Inosinate, Vinegar, Artificial Flavor and less than 2% Silicon Dioxide to prevent caking.', 'All you need.
1 pack Weber marinade mix + 1/4 cup water + 1/4 cup olive oil or corn oil + 2 lbs fish or chicken.
All you do:
1. Combine marinade mix, water and oil in a resealable plastic bag; mix well.
2. Add meat, turning to coat. Seal bag; marinate in refrigerator 15 minutes or longer, turning meat occasionally.
3. Remove meat and discard remaining marinade. Grill as desired.
Variations:
Substitute orange or pineapple juice for the water.
Try adding 2 tablespoons chopped green onion to the marinade.
Serving tip: sprinkle freshly grated parmesan cheese on top of meat just before serving!', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']

column8:
This is soooooo good! It is very garlicky/herb-y, so plan your side dishes accordingly... It would go great with pasta roni Alfredo noodles, but I think it would be weird with mashed potatoes and gravy.
I like to mix it lighter than the instructions... I use the amount of water and oil the instructions call for (I think 1/4 cup of each?), but only half a packet of seasoning. It would probably be fine full-strength, too, but we also are cooking for picky-ish kiddos :-) Plus I'm usually not using the full amount of meat they call for.
I LOVE this for keeping in the camper! I can have a bunch of different flavor packets, but the only liquid I need to bring is oil and water. Plus, there aren't any half-full... or half-empty?? :-)... bottles of marinade taking up room in our tiny camper fridge!! The package says you can try different juices as the liquid part, but I like the oil/water/packet flavor so much that I don't want to change it!! We've just used it for chicken breasts so far.
I like to put two raw chicken breasts (I wash them before I freeze them, I know they say now that you shouldn't, but that grosses me out) in a quart size ziploc bag (so they're flat, not stacked on top of each other), then freeze them flat. Then when we're camping, I can just pull out however many bags we'll need (for supper) after lunch, mix up the marinade, and split it up between the bags, and they're perfectly thawed by supper time, with no raw chicken germs in the camper (where you have limited water for cleanup). It also works to chunk up a few chicken breasts, I like to do 1.5 breasts per bag. Then my husband grills them on his Weber Q 1000 grill, and we have a delicious supper with minimal effort... Which is what camping (and summer!!) is all about!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Guess I know what we're having for supper tonight! :-)
column9: Delicious, but a very strong flavor if used full-strength
column11: ['Grocery & Gourmet Food', 'Sauces, Gravies & Marinades', 'Seasoning Mixes']
column12:
['Weber White Wine & Herb Marinade Mix.
New look!
Same great taste.', 'Salt, Maltodextrin, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder, Spices, Citric Acid, Food Starch-Modified, Red Bell Pepper, Xanthan Gum, Sherry Wine Solids, Parsley, Disodium Inosinate, Vinegar, Artificial Flavor and less than 2% Silicon Dioxide to prevent caking.', 'All you need.
1 pack Weber marinade mix + 1/4 cup water + 1/4 cup olive oil or corn oil + 2 lbs fish or chicken.
All you do:
1. Combine marinade mix, water and oil in a resealable plastic bag; mix well.
2. Add meat, turning to coat. Seal bag; marinate in refrigerator 15 minutes or longer, turning meat occasionally.
3. Remove meat and discard remaining marinade. Grill as desired.
Variations:
Substitute orange or pineapple juice for the water.
Try adding 2 tablespoons chopped green onion to the marinade.
Serving tip: sprinkle freshly grated parmesan cheese on top of meat just before serving!', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']
column13: Weber Grill Marinade White Wine & Herb, 1.12-Ounce (Pack of 12)

Same great taste.', 'Salt, Maltodextrin, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder, Spices, Citric Acid, Food Starch-Modified, Red Bell Pepper, Xanthan Gum, Sherry Wine Solids, Parsley, Disodium Inosinate, Vinegar, Artificial Flavor and less than 2% Silicon Dioxide to prevent caking.', 'All you need.
1 pack Weber marinade mix + 1/4 cup water + 1/4 cup olive oil or corn oil + 2 lbs fish or chicken.
All you do:
1. Combine marinade mix, water and oil in a resealable plastic bag; mix well.
2. Add meat, turning to coat. Seal bag; marinate in refrigerator 15 minutes or longer, turning meat occasionally.
3. Remove meat and discard remaining marinade. Grill as desired.
Variations:
Substitute orange or pineapple juice for the water.
Try adding 2 tablespoons chopped green onion to the marinade.
Serving tip: sprinkle freshly grated parmesan cheese on top of meat just before serving!', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']

column8: OMG if you've never tried this, you should. Have you ever had a Peppercorn Ribeye in a restaurant. That is what led me to try this stuff. It is even better. It makes the steaks incredibly juicy and the flavor is outstanding. I have used it on chicken too, It is a little too spicy for my wife on chicken, but she loves it on steaks. I am going to try it on hamburgers.... why not. I love this stuff.

column8: I found this Black Peppercorn a few years back. I use it with pork, chicken, steaks - even good on potatoes. However, it was hard to find it in the stores. When I would find it, I'd buy all they had. I ran out and couldn't find it. So did a search and I was amazed to find it on Amazon.com! This is great stuff! I never use anything else to marinate meats for the grill or oven.

column8: We don't usually care for marinades, but this is the exception. I used it for the first time on rib steaks, used half the package and then used the other half when cooking a Prime Rib. We didn't find it strong to pepper, but perhaps that was because I used only half the package and half the ingredients. I'm so happy that Amazon is carrying this product! I marinated both the steaks and the prime rib and then cooked it on the BBQ grill. Amazing taste and tenderness!!

column8: All of the Weber marinades are great, but the Black Peppercorn is spectacular.  We use it on beef, pork and chicken.  It is very spicy, the longer you marinate the more intense the heat.  Although the instructions don't mention it, we also use it as a dry rub when cooking ribs.

3. Remove meat and discard remaining marinade. Grill as desired.

Try adding 2 tablespoons chopped green onion to the marinade.
Serving tip: sprinkle freshly grated parmesan cheese on top of meat just before serving!', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']

column8: Absolute best marinade ever.  I could go on and on about it - but really, that sums it up.  I found it at home hardware store of all places, and ended up buying them out over the summer - was so happy to come and see it available on Amazon.  I've never cared much for any marinade I've bought before (I usually just cobble together my own because it's as good as everything I have found) but this stuff is so great I've gone and bought a 50-pack and will keep getting it.  Absolute perfection.

column8: We absolutely love the flavor of Weber's White Wine & Herb marinade.  The flavors are so delicious, we always get many compliments from friends and family. Kroger's stopped carrying it, so I am delighted to have found it on amazon.com.

column12:
['Weber White Wine & Herb Marinade Mix.
New look!
Same great taste.', 'Salt, Maltodextrin, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder, Spices, Citric Acid, Food Starch-Modified, Red Bell Pepper, Xanthan Gum, Sherry Wine Solids, Parsley, Disodium Inosinate, Vinegar, Artificial Flavor and less than 2% Silicon Dioxide to prevent caking.', 'All you need.
1 pack Weber marinade mix + 1/4 cup water + 1/4 cup olive oil or corn oil + 2 lbs fish or chicken.
All you do:
1. Combine marinade mix, water and oil in a resealable plastic bag; mix well.
2. Add meat, turning to coat. Seal bag; marinate in refrigerator 15 minutes or longer, turning meat occasionally.
3. Remove meat and discard remaining marinade. Grill as desired.
Variations:
Substitute orange or pineapple juice for the water.
Try adding 2 tablespoons chopped green onion to the marinade.
Serving tip: sprinkle freshly grated parmesan cheese on top of meat just before serving!', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']
column13: Weber Grill Marinade White Wine & Herb, 1.12-Ounce (Pack of 12)

column8: A really great marinade for chicken and fish and I have even used it on beef (but added onions and garlic).  You can fry, bake or grill chicken with it with perfect results but Ive only baked the fish and beef.

column8: I could no longer find the Black Peppercorn marinade I used to buy from Durkee, so I tried this instead and I couldn't tell them apart!  You can exchange the water and vinegar for whatever liquid you prefer and it marinates perfectly in as little as 15 minutes.  For our Christmas beef tenderloin, I used a combination of orange juice, black raspberry vinegar, and olive oil with the package mix and marinated it about an hour before grilling.  It was soooo delicious!

column8: I never actually saw this in person as I sent it as a gift.  But it arrived fairly quickly, the company was pleasant to work with, and my grandmother said the chocolate was really good.  She said it arrived all neatly packaged as described.  I wish I could have seen it.  This is something I would definitely send to someone as a gift again.
column9: Sent to out of state Grandma for her Birthday
column11: ['Grocery & Gourmet Food', 'Food & Beverage Gifts', 'Candy & Chocolate Gifts']
column12:
['Send a gift that towers over the rest - literally. The Ghirardelli Tower is a best seller for a reason. It features a premium selection of traditional favorites from America\'s much loved chocolatier. Offering an assortment of milk and dark chocolate squares, chocolate chip cookies, dark chocolate caramel popcorn and more, this tower brings the distinct quality of Ghirardelli to life. This gift is a great value, perfect for family and friends and any occasion.

The majesty of the Golden Gate Bridge and Ghirardelli Square comes to life in this chocolate gift tower.

It features an assortment of milk and dark chocolate squares, dark chocolate drops, milk and dark chocolate with caramel, chocolate chip cookies, dark chocolate caramel corn, white mocha coffee drink mix, double chocolate hot cocoa and more of their very best.

Gift Size: 8" x 4" x 16"', 'The Finest Gourmet Gifts', 'Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.']
column13: Wine Country Gift Baskets Ghirardelli Tower

column8:
We received this beautiful tower as a gift just before Christmas. It is quite lovely, the boxes sparkly and tied up in a great golden bow! This tower was a bit like an Advent Calendar for the whole family (or just the adults if you don't want to share!) in that we looked forward to opening one box each day with great anticipation!

Ghiradelli is most definitely our favorite chocolatier, and each item in the tower was quite delicious and excellent quality. We enjoyed this gift so much, we will be looking for similar items to give to others next year!
column9: What a lovely gift to Receive!

column8: I received this as a gift, and believe me I will never tell the giver how pitiful this tower is.  The white hot chocolate package had leaked powder mix throughout the package, and spilled out when I opened the box.  Once opened the contents would barely fill a 2 cup measuring cup.  Very sad.  Just a small handful of tiny cookies, small palm full of chocolate button candies, and several of the thin square chocolates. One hot chocolate mix, as I had to toss the leaking one.  It is the thought that counts, but wish I could warn them not to use this vendor again.

column8:
such a disappointment.  The boxes are tiny, which I kind of expected.  My intention was to reuse them, but they are interlocking, making them unusable except as a decorative tiny tower.

The contents are drab, stingey, and not at all a happy gift.  One box contained a single serving of powdered cocoa!  Another box held three square chocolates, and three even tinier in another.  I was embarrassed to have given this and was glad I was there when it was opened so I could apologize.

Unless you want to be Uncle Scrooge, and get scrooged at the same time, don't buy this.

column8: I sent this to my mother-in-law who loves her edible treats. She loved it! She said the arrangement of the boxes in a Christmas tree shape was so pretty she kept it out as a display during the season. She said she opened a different treat every day which was like opening a little gift each day to make the season last longer. She also said that every treat inside was delicious. When she called she said my sister-in-law was going to keep it at her house and limit her to one treat per day. "Not gonna happen!" she said.

column8: This year, I bought this gift tower for my boyfriend's family. I thought that this chocolate tower would make a great impression on them. At first it did the job, they loved how beautiful it looked and were very excited to open up all the boxes (the boxes are tiny in comparison with the pic). After that, the great first impression quickly faded as they opened up the packages to see that all the chocolates had melted and were now stuck together! They couldn't even open the chocolate bars because the foil was stuck to them. I didn't understand how the chocolate could have melted together because I was home when this package was delivered to me, so the package was not outside at any point. I contacted the seller 3 weeks ago and was ignored! Don't waste your money!

column8: If you're thinking about buying this think no more..... BUY IT!!!!!!!!! It came super fast which I was worried about it not getting here in time for Christmas!!!!!!! It came two days after I ordered it and I LOVED IT!!!!!!! The bow was the perfect touch!!! I'm 12 and wanted to get a special present for my parents (in addition to the 50 others) and this was definatly their favorite!!!!!!!! I will probably order this many more times!!!!!! IT LOOKS WAAAAAAY BETTER IN PERSON THAN IN THE PICTURE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My only disappointment would be that it's only like 1 1/2 feet tall when I thought it would be like 4 feet but that's my fault so ORDER THIS because IT'S PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

column8: We received this as a gift and were terribly disappointed. The contents were sparse, especially for the price. A bag of six tiny cookies, a couple of ounces of caramel corn, a few squares of chocolate, a single serving of hot chocolate. Maybe $5 worth of product. But worse than that, the chocolate items were not only melted but also OLD! There were what looked like kisses, but they were melted together and powdery. They tasted terrible. Same with the foil-wrapped chocolates -- old and melted. The manufacturer should be ashamed of selling this product.

column8:
The ingredients for the "new recipe" wine gums are correctly listed for the single 2.2 lb pack.  The ingredient list for the 3-pack box is the older, discontinued version.  Reviewers are divided in their response to the new recipe.  I don't think there is much to debate:  the new items are slightly smaller (9 per 40 g serving vs. the the older 7 per serving) and certainly less chewy.  More like a gummy as one reviewer observed.  The taste, however, has been enhanced.  In my view, the different flavors are, in fact, distinguishable (in contrast to another reviewer who thinks they all taste the same), and more intense and flavorful.  They would be perfect if the manufacturer made them more like a wine gum and less like a gummy.  I have been throwing them in the freezer and, as they soften in my mouth, I re-capture some of the old-style chewiness.

UPDATE:  4/25/15.  The "new recipe" is the outcome of the manufacturer's decision to make the product gluten free.  The recipe was modified and new equipment was used in the manufacturing process.  Almost all consumers agree that the new product is different from the old product regardless of which one they prefer.  The old recipe is still available as "Gumbilees" in 5.2 oz packets.  So the consumer has a choice:  the bulk 3-pack, a total of 6.6 lbs or just over 100 oz or a 12-pack box of Gumbilees (about 66 oz) for roughly the same price on Amazon.  The bulk 3-pack is about 50% more product for the same cost, while the Gumbilees offer the older product in convenient pocket packs.  If you want Gustaf's, you have the choice of old or new.  Happy chewing!

column8:
I have ordered Gustav's wine gums many times from amazon and always been delighted with the product. Well imagine my surprise when I recently opened my latest order to discover a "new formula" product that bears no resemblance to the old. The wine gums are smaller, harder, much paler in color, and all colors have this same wretchedly super-sweet after-taste that just "keeps on giving" me something that I definitely do not want.
Why has Gustav begun shipping a different product with no advance notice to its loyal customers? Well this is one former customer who is definitely no longer loyal! I'm stuck with 6.6kg. of these things and I'm seriously tempted to throw them in the garbage.
Smarten up, Gustav's! Refund my money for this inferior garbage, or ship me what I ordered - the original product. I don't want this crap. And I'm betting nobody else does either.
column9: Gustav's New Formula Wine Gums - They're Terrible!!

column8: These are so good. Unfortunately if you live outside the UK it's difficult to find wine gums that are fresh and not hard as a rock. These are soft and chewy (& fresh every time we have ordered) just like the English type. Also other reviews mention a wine flavor. These are not supposed to taste like wine or alcohol-they are shaped like little liquor bottles but are actually flavored with orange, lemon, blackcurrant etc. The blackcurrant is my favorite!
